definition: abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: He was fascinated by Sichuan Opera performances in Chengdu's teahouses.
sentences.chinese: 之后，他对成都茶馆里的川剧表演着了迷。

sentences.english: The tottering cause of Sichuan Opera seems to have successors.
sentences.chinese: 风雨飘摇中的川剧事业似乎后继有人。

sentences.english: The Sichuan opera Pan Jinlian examines Pan Jinli an's degradation from different perspectives.
sentences.chinese: 川剧《潘金莲》从不同视角中审视潘金莲的沉沦。

sentences.english: Sichuan Opera is a typical local opera in Sichuan Province.
sentences.chinese: 川剧是比较有代表性的四川地方戏。

sentences.english: Jinjiang Theatre on Huaxing Street is a good place to enjoy Sichuan Opera.
sentences.chinese: 华兴街的锦江剧场是看川剧的好去处。

sentences.english: Thus face changing became a special art form of Sichuan opera.
sentences.chinese: 这样，变脸就成为川剧中的一种艺术特技。

sentences.english: Along with the Sichuan Opera "warming up", the theater building also warm up.
sentences.chinese: 伴随着川剧的“升温”，剧场的建设问题也随之而来。

definition: Xieju opera (ballad and dancing monologue, popular in Sichuan)
opera for popular in Sichuan and Yunnan
Qinqiang, an opera style popular in northwest China, possibly originating in Ming dynasty folk music/Shaanxi opera
opera highlights performed as independent pieces
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
Kunqu opera, influential musical theater originating in Kunshan, Jiangsu province in Yuan times
